bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, January 19, 1919

div1.p: Carter writes about daily life in Florida and his health.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, January 19, 1919
div1.p:
Today is Lee's Birth Day
& the Custom House is closed-
at least in part - & the stata-
tician is gone fishing,- ergo I
have got to rest- for at least
part of the day.

I am well enough
to fish finish it all today &
leave tomorrow morning
or tonight at 9.30, if I could
get a berth- I wait however,
still I will try- to make such
a reservation this afternoon
& leave tomorrow night.

I am practically well; Cough
nearly
nearly gone & not especially
weak. Also I Judge that I am
immunized against - a certain
strain - of respiratory infections
for a short time.

I will not mail this un-
til I get to Jacksonville - Wednes-
day morning.

I finished today about 12. We
ate Lunch & lay down to 3
P.M. Have my reservation
to Jacksonville engaged & feel
well. Cold entir will be en-
tirely gone by morning - prac-
tically well now.

I think, I will leave for Baltimore
Thursday or Friday night- It is 2426
hours run. 26 May leave the
morning after - I have said - Friday or Sat-
turday. Will wait this in
Jacksonville

Love to all with you. I judge
Henry got in Sunday. I will
find one of your letters when
I get to Jacksonville & hope to
hear that Reid has been heard
from
